column4: My CPU Temperature is reading as 77 degrees in my BIOS. Is this too hot?
celsuis
sorry :p
fisk
:o
can I check the temp from Ubuntu? my bios may be incorrect.
gkrellm has some good sensor plugins.
my CPU usage percentage is really high (like 50%)
you are using top to scope this out?
system monitor, CPU fire applet, AWN widget.
what are the gkrellm plugins called?
ah. Are yo getting any specific process info? like which process is pulling the most mem or cpu? you can search for gkrellm in synaptic or just 'aptitude search gkrellm'
you just might want to off the greedy bugger that is hogging cpu all the time.
beagled
yeah. its a pig.
it should only index once really heavy a day at the most.
you can find the PID of beagled and kill it if you want. It shouldn't last forever tho.
problem is fixed. Beagle: very evil for memory
heh. I always thought it was a piggy. Cool tool though.
thanks
welcome.
